articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's cabinet approved a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire and release of hostages in the Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Saturday, a day ahead of the agreement's scheduled start.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire accord, due to take effect Sunday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four people were killed early on Saturday in the centre of Kyiv in a night-time Russian attack, said Timur Tkachenko, head of the Ukrainian capital's military administration.
articles.title: Four dead in night-time Russian attack on Kyiv, military administration says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The platform has until Sunday to cut ties with its China-based parent, ByteDance, or shut down its U.S. operation to resolve concerns it posed a threat to national security.
articles.title: TikTok faces US ban deadline as users brace for fallout

articles.author: James Oliphant, Steve Holland
articles.description: The goal is to inject political loyalists deep into the workings of government, perhaps more so than any other recent president.
articles.title: How Trump aims to dismantle the ‘deep state’ and assert control

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: The mother of American journalist Austin Tice, who was taken captive during a reporting trip to Syria in August 2012, arrived in Damascus on Saturday to step up the search for her son and said she hopes she can take him home with her.
articles.title: Austin Tice's mother, in Damascus, hopes to find son missing since 2012

articles.author: Ahmed Kingimi
articles.description: At least 60 people were killed and more injured in northern Nigeria on Saturday when a petrol tanker truck overturned, spilling fuel that exploded, the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) said.
articles.title: Fuel tanker truck blast kills at least 60 in Nigeria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yoon Suk Yeol,South Korea's impeached president, plans to attend a court hearing on Saturday to fight a request by investigators to extend his detention on accusations of insurrection, his lawyer said.
articles.title: South Korea's President Yoon to attend court hearing on extending detention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Most army-controlled areas in Sudan have been plunged into blackouts following drone attacks on power generation facilities by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, government officials and residents told Reuters.
articles.title: Blackouts hit wide swathes of army-controlled Sudan after drone attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A ski lift collapsed at a resort in the Spanish region of Aragon on Saturday, injuring dozens of people, nine of them very seriously and eight seriously, the regional government said.
articles.title: Dozens injured, trapped in a ski lift accident in the north of Spain

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in the central Indian state of Chhattisgarh on Saturday detained a second person suspected of involvement in a knife attack in which Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was wounded.
articles.title: India police detain second suspect in Saif Ali Khan stabbing incident
